name: LaunchFlow
long_description:
[LaunchFlow](https://www.launchflow.com/) is an Infrastructure as Code Python SDK that extends OpenTofu with features like [multi-environment support](https://docs.launchflow.com/docs/concepts/environments), [autoconfigured infrastructure clients](https://docs.launchflow.com/docs/concepts/resources), and [API release management](https://docs.launchflow.com/docs/concepts/services).

You can add GCP / AWS infrastructure to your app with a single line of code - Includes integrations with [FastAPI](https://docs.launchflow.com/docs/framework-guides/fastapi), [Flask](https://docs.launchflow.com/docs/framework-guides/flask), and [Django](https://docs.launchflow.com/docs/framework-guides/django).

It only takes 3 commands to launch your first app to GCP or AWS\
$ pip install launchflow \
$ lf init \
$ lf deploy 

Follow the [Get Started Guide](https://docs.launchflow.com/docs/get-started) to launch an example FastAPI app in a matter of minutes. No account required.
one_liner: Automate infrastructure on GCP and AWS with Python
